name: Mixed Bag 10 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [C] | 10 Questions

questions.text: A dish served au poivre is made with what?
Which apostle wrote the earliest and shortest gospel?
questions.explanation:
Mark.

	His short ending drew on the gospel of Luke to compose a more satisfying ending.

questions.text: (True or False) When designed in 1791, Washington D.C. was called Federal City?
questions.explanation:
True & T.

	It was laid out by Pierre Charles L'Enfant.

questions.text: In what country did the kettledrum originate?
questions.explanation:
Arabia.

	In 10th century Arabia. It was soon brought to Europe.

questions.text: Which film is longer, 'Cleopatra' or 'Gone With The Wind'?
questions.explanation:
'Cleopatra' & Cleopatra.

	'Cleopatra' was 243 minutes long and 'Gone With The Wind' was 222 minutes long.

questions.text: In what year was Alan Shepard's first trip to outer space?
What is a single picture on a strip of movie film called?
questions.explanation:
Frame.

	In the 1920s the standard for sound film was 24 frames per second.

questions.text: NBC made the first TV broadcast in what year?
questions.explanation:
1936.

	It actually started expermental broadcasts in New York City in 1930.

questions.text: What was the name of Milton Berle's famous secretary?
Who played Billie the Kid in the 1958 film 'The Left Handed Gun'?
questions.explanation:
Paul Newman.

	Directed by Arthur Penn.
